intro: Gynochthodes coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features rough, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into elongated, slender seed pods. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Gynochthodes coriacea is known for its resilience and ability to withstand drought conditions.
